intro: Tabernanthe pubescens, commonly known as the sacred lotus of Africa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. The flowers bloom in clusters and are known for their fragrance, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
